intro: Myosotis jenissejensis, commonly known as the Jenisej River forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the Siberian region of Russia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as riverbanks and wet meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hair, while its flowers bloom in early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
